articles.title: Mars landing team 'awestruck' by photo of descending rover - 9News
articles.description: The world got its first close-up look at a Mars landing on Friday, as NASA released a stunning picture of its newest rover being lowered onto the dusty red surface.

articles.title: Volunteers hope efforts to remove invasive northern Pacific seastar will make a difference - ABC News
articles.description: For almost four decades Tasmanians have waged war against the invasive northern Pacific seastar, now a group of divers are hoping their sustained effort to remove it will make a difference — and they have science on their side.
articles.content:

articles.title: NASA Missions Make Unprecedented Map of Sun's Magnetic Field - NASA
articles.description: For the first time, a NASA mission has made multi-height measurements of the solar chromosphere’s magnetic field. The observations extend our measurement capability into a region of the Sun that has so far eluded scientific grasp.

articles.title: Study Suggests Earth’s Protective Magnetic Shield Failed 42,000 Years Ago - Forbes
articles.description: The temporary decline in Earth's magnetic field strength 42,000 years ago caused climate shifts that led to global environmental change and mass extinctions, a new study claims.

articles.title: Morocco Factory Boss Held in Deadly Flood Probe - Asharq Al-awsat - English
articles.description:
Moroccan authorities have detained the owner of an underground textile factory in Tangiers where 28 people died earlier this month, trapped when storm waters flooded in, prosecutors said.
The owner is being held in custody as investigations continue
